intro: Phlogacanthus pulcherrimus, commonly known as the purple-flowered spurge, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its striking violet to purple flowers, which are typically clustered in complex inflorescences. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodland or grassland habitats.
